so when i think of who she will canonically end up with
summary: Do you want Arya and Gendry to end up together?
question: Do you want Arya and Gendry to end up together?
answer:
I don’t not want Arya and Gendry to end up together.

I would like it a lot if they had a happy ending and I love that ship a lot-but I will say I also am not heavily invested in them as a ship either so I wouldn’t be devastated if they didn’t end up together.


Personally my favorite endings with arya don’t really address her with a romantic partner at all because she’s so young in the books and so uninterested in the show.

summary: Re Sansa ships, I shipped Jonsa before S6 due to stuff in the books but never thought it would happen, I thought Sansa/Edric...
question: Re Sansa ships, I shipped Jonsa before S6 due to stuff in the books but never thought it would happen, I thought Sansa/Edric could happen. Since Sansa&Jon reunited on the show I'm convinced Jonsa will happen in some form, I still expect Jon to die though. Sandry is a long shot but you never know because I think there will need to be new alliances between the kingdoms & marriage is the obvious way to do that. With few main characters likely to survive what marriages do you think could happen?
answer:
the problem with sansa/edric endgame is that house dayne is a minor house. unless sansa met him and fell in love very quickly in the books, i don’t see her marrying him esp when her marriage could bring kingdoms together since she has ties to 3 kingdoms. it’s still possible, after all he is strong, brave and gentle. 

book and show jonsa metas have swayed me a lot. it went from a crackship to something that could possibly be endgame. after all why mention sansa in the same breath as jon and dany? sansa can’t be the only person who disagrees with jon’s choice to bend the knee.

it’s hard because the show’s scope is pretty small. they don’t care about so many important houses. i doubt tristane will die in the books. if he had lived in the show, i would have said sansa x tristane is a possibility. tyrion’s dead. jon’s survival is dubious. euron is gone definitely and so are cersei and jaime. that leaves theon, one of the northern lords and one of the vale lords. all three are disqualified because theon has been castrated (the show treats it like a joke, like he’s less of a man. i doubt they’ll pair him with one of the main women). the only prominent vale lord is lord royce who is married. the northern lords we see are married too. that leaves a maybe alive jon.

as for arya, maybe gendry. then again d&d made the weird choice to have him not mention her once with jon. i mean sandor did. who knows? bran might marry meera or (weird i know) lyanna mormont or they’ll write him as the three eyed raven till the end because disabled people don’t deserve happy endings. if missandei survives, i think greyworm will die.

that’s it for the characters i know for sure are surviving. the rest are minor characters who don’t have romantic scenes.

blog.name: first-of-her-nxme
blog.title: I see you, wolf child. Blood child

question: why did Jaqen leave Arya ?
answer:
Book spoilers

In the show he left her to come back to Braavos. In the books the story is very different : 

“…the battle is begun,” said Melisandre. “The sand is running through the glass more quickly now, and man’s hour on earth is almost done.”

When Yoren and his recruits were attacked by the Gods Eye Jaqen asked Arya had the red war begun. Arya saved his life so he stayed with her in Harrenhal to pay his debt. He promised to kill three men for her, one for every life she saved. Arya didn’t rush with choosing her preys, she wanted to keep Jaqen in Harrenhal as long as possible. She felt brave when he was around. But Jaqen heard the whisper of sand in a glass too. He wanted a dragon to join his red war. Euron Greyjoy wanted to hire a faceless man to kill Balon Greyjoy. The Faceless Men demanded a dragon egg as payment. Euron agreed. Jaqen left Arya to get his dragon and keep his promises. 

Thank you for the ask :)

summary: ASOIAF INSTAGRAM AU: Arya always thought girly things were dumb and pointless, until she met Myrcella. Normally, she’d never...
caption: ASOIAF INSTAGRAM AU: Arya always thought girly things were dumb and pointless, until she met Myrcella. Normally, she’d never have the patience to hang out with a girl who spent more than five minutes getting ready in the morning, but there’s something about Cella that draws her in. When Myrcella kisses her behind the bleachers after school, Arya finally figures out what that is.

summary: I feel like Arya's endgame in the show will be a make or break type of situation for me.  S8 could be as good as the earlier...
body: I feel like Arya’s endgame in the show will be a make or break type of situation for me. S8 could be as good as the earlier seasons, but if they show Arya randomly leaving Westeros or continuing with FM crap or just being someone’s “sword” I think that could be a season ruiner. Like just the thought of any of that makes me want to scream mainly because it could also be seen as book!Canon up until the end of the book series which is beyond frustrating. I for one don’t trust d&d to stay with Arya’s book endgame since so much of her story has already been changed. I just don’t look forward to the headache so I’m crossing my fingers and praying to the old gods and R'hollor that my fears are for naught.

summary: Needle was Robb and Bran and Rickon, her mother and her father, even Sansa. Needle was Winterfell’s grey walls, and the laughter...
caption: Needle was Robb and Bran and Rickon, her mother and her father, even Sansa. Needle was Winterfell’s grey walls, and the laughter of its people. Needle was the summer snows, Old Nan’s stories, the heart tree with its red leaves and scary face, the warm earthy smell of the glass gardens, the sound of the north wind rattling the shutters of her room. Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. The Many-Faced God can have the rest, Arya thought, but he can’t have this.

blog.name: tatticstudio55
blog.title: pro jonerys who likes healthy debates

title: The scrub
body:
(Written for the Jon/Arya/Dany appreciation week)

Like Daenerys’s, Arya journey is a cathartic one: where Daenerys purify with fire, Arya’s story arc is one where wildlands purge themselves in water. Water brings what’s rotten at the surface. On her way North with Yoren and the Night’s Watch recruits, Arya hear wolves howling almost every night, while all the “dirt” is carried (flooded out) down South:

The human flood that had flowed down the kingsroad was only a trickle here.

(…)

The water had a funny taste to it, and Lommy told them it was the taste of bodies, rotting someplace upstream.

(…)

It seemed a peaceful place … until Koss spotted the dead man. “There, in the reeds.” He pointed, and Arya saw it. The body of a soldier, shapeless and swollen. His sodden green cloak had hung up on a rotted log, and a school of tiny silver fishes were nibbling at his face.

“I told you there was bodies,” Lommy announced. “I could taste them in that water.” – Arya, ACOK

While water is the “cleansing” substance, the lands themselves come alive, symbolized by the abnormal amount of wolves in the surrounding forests. There’s a bit of a “Noah’s arch” aspect to Arya’s journey through the Riverland: it rains and rains and rains, and Yoren’s wagons are “large enough to hold half the animals in the town” (ARYA, ACOK). At some point, water and fire come together: “On the night of their escape, the flames of the burning town had shimmered so brightly on the water that it had seemed that the lake was afire” (ARYA, ACOK). Like water, fire is cleansing and allows rebirth. During her travels with Gendry, Lommy and Hot Pie, Arya keep wishing that she could wash herself in water (“Arya felt as though the lake were calling her. She wanted to leap into those placid blue waters, to feel clean again, to swim and splash and bask in the sun. But she dare not take off her clothes where the others could see, not even to wash them”), be reborn from water, even…

The water lapped softly around her legs. A few lantern bugs were coming out, their little lights blinking on and off. The green water was warm as tears, but there was no salt in it. It tasted of summer and mud and growing things. Arya plunged her face down into it to wash off the dust and dirt and sweat of the day. When she leaned back the trickles ran down the back of her neck and under her collar. They felt good. She wished she could take off her clothes and swim, gliding through the warm water like a skinny pink otter. – Arya, ACOK

Here, for instance, the water is synonymous of renewal – summer, mud and growing things – and the skinny pink otter might more or less be a newborn figure. However, like Daenerys, Arya is ultimately reborn in fire, not water. The scene where Arya return inside the burning barn to save Jaqen H’ghar has some striking similarities to the one where Dany step into the pyre:

And there came a second crack, loud and sharp as thunder, and the smoke stirred and whirled around her and the pyre shifted, the logs exploding as the fire touched their secret hearts. – Dany, AGOT

Arya was running, coughing. She heard the steel crash through the old wood, and again, again. An instant later came a crack as loud as thunder, and the bottom of the wagon came ripping loose in an explosion of splinters. – Arya, ACOK

And afterward, when Arya rushes into the tunnel to escape the barn, the scene is described in an ambiguous way, almost like she was a newborn leaving the womb:

Arya rolled headfirst into the tunnel and dropped five feet. She got dirt in her mouth but she didn’t care, the taste was fine, the taste was mud and water and worms and life. Under the earth the air was cool and dark. Above was nothing but blood and roaring red and choking smoke and the screams of dying horses. She moved her belt around so Needle would not be in her way, and began to crawl. A dozen feet down the tunnel she heard the sound, like the roar of some monstrous beast, and a cloud of hot smoke and black dust came billowing up behind her, smelling of hell. Arya held her breath and kissed the mud on the floor of the tunnel and cried. For whom, she could not say. – Arya, ACOK

Of course, there’s a lot to unravel here: Dany hatches three dragons; Arya frees three men from the wagon. One of these men is Jaqen H’ghar, who, much like dragons, is linked to eastern magic. Arya rolls “headfirst into the tunnel” (babies usually come out headfirst of their mother’s “tunnel”) and, like an infant, starts to crawl (“she moved her belt around (…) and began to crawl”). The earth itself is a bit of a mother’s womb, dark and safe and damp. All the while, above Arya’s head, the burning barn might’ve as well hatched a dragon of its own (the roar of the “monstrous beast” and the “hot smoke and black dust”). Soon after, she starts having warg dreams. She finds her pack and start cleaning up, dragging the “rot” out of the water (it’s implied that is was Nymeria who found Catelyn’s body in the river). Arya’s warg business in the Riverland mirror Dany’s in Essos: flood, clean up, start anew. Burn, clean up, start anew. It’s messy, it’s dangerous, but fire cannot kill Daenerys Stormborn and the wild cannot kill Arya Stark.

blog.name: westerosiladies
blog.title: GoT Ladies
blog.description: A blog dedicated to the badass ladies of Westeros (There will probably be some stuff on the guys too, but mostly ladies)

summary: “Is the girl ready? To give up her ears, her nose, her tongue? Her hopes and dreams, her loves and hates, all that makes a girl...
body:
“Is the girl ready? To give up her ears, her nose, her tongue? Her hopes and dreams, her loves and hates, all that makes a girl who she is, forever?

No, a girl is not ready to become no one. But she is ready to become someone else.”

reblog.comment:
“Is the girl ready? To give up her ears, her nose, her tongue? Her hopes and dreams, her loves and hates, all that makes a girl who she is, forever?

No, a girl is not ready to become no one. But she is ready to become someone else.”

trail.content_raw:
“Is the girl ready? To give up her ears, her nose, her tongue? Her hopes and dreams, her loves and hates, all that makes a girl who she is, forever?

No, a girl is not ready to become no one. But she is ready to become someone else.”
trail.content:
“Is the girl ready? To give up her ears, her nose, her tongue? Her hopes and dreams, her loves and hates, all that makes a girl who she is, forever?

No, a girl is not ready to become no one. But she is ready to become someone else.”

blog.name: gendrie
blog.title: fierce and terrible and hers
blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

tags: but my biggest fear is that this is what the show does
since d&d and cogman hate arya
we'll have to wait and see
even if they do i will never accept it as arya's true endgame tho
summary: what really gets me about the arya leaves westeros in the end “theories” is that arya literally already tried that. she...
body:
what really gets me about the arya leaves westeros in the end “theories” is that arya literally already tried that. she dramatically left westeros behind. she thought there was nothing left for her there but ghosts and ruins and pain and hunger. so she left her entire world and everything she knew - her home, her pack, her language, her culture, her faith. most were lost to her anyway or so she believed. so arya plunged herself into the unknown. (but the opportunity to return to westeros - to jon - to her home is never far from her mind) she went to a foreign city on a different continent where she’s trying to let go of the past. the kindly man even offers her a life outside the house of black and white - she could marry, get a job, ect. the entire world is open to her. if she wanted arya could board a ship, explore and never look back.

but she can’t let arya stark go. in grrm’s own words “she cant quite give [needle] up” so why??? when given back her pack and her home and her name would she decide to leave westeros……again? even when arya thought she had lost everything she was unable to truly let go

after arya heard winterfell had been burned she first considers flying away; up past the stars and the moon to parts unknown. its then the old gods remind her: “the lone wolf dies but the pack survives” “You are Arya of Winterfell, daughter of the north.” and arya herself understands. thats who she is and thats where she belongs.

blog.name: aqueenofmarble
blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

tags: anyone who says otherwise is wrong
summary:
One taught me love.
One taught me patience.
One taught me pain.
body:
One taught me love.

One taught me patience.

One taught me pain.

reblog.comment:
One taught me love.

One taught me patience.

One taught me pain.

One taught me patience.

One taught me pain.

One taught me patience.

One taught me pain.
